column4: you have that logic backwards. Google logs everything, and has been known to break the law with personal data. ISPs don't log enough information to identify specific individuals.
there may be privacy concerns with google *shrug* but I trust then to update more often and provide accurate ips on my lookup requests
I'm sure ISP don't supply their own dns hosts. I can almost assume google is involved in some way with providing dns to big boys and their subs.
perhaps a deeper discussion, but that topic doesn't keep the channel on track.
